name: Atiyah conjecture
summary:
Michael Atiyah introduced the {\displaystyle l^{2}}-cohomology of manifolds with a discrete countable group's free co-compact action in 1976. This includes the universal cover of a compact manifold and the basic group's action through deck transformations. Atiyah calculated multiple examples, all of which proved to be rational numbers, and defined {\displaystyle l^{2}}-Betti numbers as von Neumann dimensions of the resulting {\displaystyle l^{2}}-cohomology groups. Thus, he inquired as to whether {\displaystyle l^{2}}-Betti numbers may be irrational.

Since then, a number of scholars have posed more specific queries regarding the values of {\displaystyle l^{2}}-Betti numbers, which are collectively known as the "Atiyah conjecture."
